cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the Caribbean and forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico, then curve northwest toward the north-western Gulf Coast – highest likelihood of a strike on the Louisiana–Texas border region.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Cameron–Lake Charles area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches confined to Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic, Haiti, parts of Cuba and the Bahamas; no Gulf Coast watches yet.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Puerto Rico, the U.S./British Virgin Islands, the Dominican Republic, Haiti and the Turks & Caicos; none yet for the Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana is highlighted in the 4-5-day cone as the most likely impact corridor.
weather_observation.wind: Probability of tropical-storm-force winds at Lake Charles rises to nearly 30% by day-5; hurricane-force risk remains below 5% at this lead time but could increase with future intensification.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Laura intensifies to a hurricane in the north-western Gulf, a 3–5 ft surge is plausible along southwest Louisiana including Calcasieu Pass and Lake Charles ship channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible in southwest Louisiana with locally higher totals if the core tracks inland near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in rain-bands and fresh-water flooding of low-lying terminal yards/access roads.
